text: I'm Christian boomerang and I'm the chef
and owner of night market restaurant in
LA and today we're gonna talk about Thai
sausage so mixing the meat is super easy
but the tricky part is how you're gonna
stuff the sausage so you can either go
get an attachment for your KitchenAid or
you can use one of these Chinese soup
spoons and that's what we're gonna do
today okay so these are our sausage
casings I always recommend you get pork
casings natural casings and a lot of
times when you get them they're gonna
compact and salt like this so what we
got to do is rinse all that off so what
I've done here is soaked it in cold
water with a tablespoon of white vinegar
cut just sort of a I don't know a fairly
generous length to a feet or so tie it
off on the end with some kitchen twine
first thing you got to do is slip the
narrow end of your soup spoon into the
case what I like to do is also work the
rest of the casing out of his food
that's just gonna make it easier to
stuff hold the casing open the way I do
that is with my index finger and my
middle finger top and bottom so we got
the pork it's a red curry paste kaffir
lime leaves a bunch of lemongrass fish
sauce and sugar so you want to start
with like a little meatball sized wad at
a time so we're gonna put our meat onto
the wide end of the spoon and then we're
gonna get stuffing that's all there is
to it
so once you've gotten a fair amount in
what you want to do is it's push it down
squeeze through like that and you're
just inching it down just bit by bit try
to get all the meat in there so there's
what you're looking for a nice six-inch
sausage and we're gonna tie it off at
this point and then continue stuffing
and then right before we pop it in the
oven we're gonna poke holes in this with
like a wooden skewer or something and
that's just to allow moisture to escape
when it's in the oven so you want to pop
it in for like thirty minutes at 350 and
then right before you serve it throw it
on a cast-iron skillet
throw it on the grill however you want
to do it and this is what you end up
with awesome Thai sausage all stuffed
with a Chinese soup spoon
